definition: to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: The room was darkening. he turned over towards the light and lay gazing into the glass paper weight.
sentences.chinese: 屋子裏開始發暗，他轉身湊着光亮，盯着玻璃鎮紙看。

sentences.english: He turned over towards the light and lay gazing into the glass paperweight.
sentences.chinese: 屋子裏開始發暗，他轉身湊着光亮，盯着玻璃鎮紙看。

sentences.english: But Heinrich Wang and a small glass paperweight changed all that.
sentences.chinese: 但是王俠軍和一個小小玻璃鎮紙改寫了歷史。

sentences.english: His eye fell on the fragments of the glass paperweight.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼光落到了玻璃鎮紙的碎片上。

sentences.english: Without the detonator codes, those older nukes were no more dangerous than paperweights.
sentences.chinese: 沒有起爆編碼，這些老式的核彈頭還不如鎮紙危險。

definition: ribbon (as a decoration)/cordon (diagonal belt worn as a sign of office or honor)
small cup for adding water to an ink stone
kesi or k’o-ssu, Chinese silk tapestry woven in a pictorial design
high-quality ink stonemade in Duanxi and Guangdong
